Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on police-civilian investigative encounters
Items.MatterName: How Many Stops Act - Requiring the police dept to report on police-civilian investigative encounters.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor – Mayor’s veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 586-A of 2022, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on police-civilian investigative encounters.
Items.MatterName: Mayor’s Veto - Int. No. 586-A of 2022, How Many Stops Act - Requiring the police dept to report on police-civilian investigative encounters.
